vulnerability_location.description: Multiplication of user-controlled seed[0] and seed[1] without overflow checks can lead to integer overflow (and potential division by zero) in the expression _seed/(seed[0]*seed[1])
Low-level .call.value() calls without checking the return value

Using transfer to send the entire contract balance to the winner. If the winner is a contract whose fallback consumes more than 2300 gas or reverts, the transfer will always fail and lock the funds, resulting in a denial of service.
Using keccak256(blockhash(block.number-1)) as a source of randomness, which is predictable and manipulable by miners
Constructor name does not match contract name (DrainMe vs DranMe), so `owner` is never initialized and remains 0x0.
